network_memory.content:
üéØ ORIGINAL TASK REQUIREMENT:
It's May 2023, and I'm about to drive across the U.S. from California to Maine. I always recycle my water bottles at the end of a trip, and I drink 5 12-ounce water bottles for every 100 miles I travel, rounded to the nearest 100. Assuming I follow I-40 from Los Angeles to Cincinnati, then take I-90 from Cincinnati to Augusta, how many dollars will I get back according to Wikipedia?
================================================================================
Step 1 - Current Task Input:
It's May 2023, and I'm about to drive across the U.S. from California to Maine. I always recycle my water bottles at the end of a trip, and I drink 5 12-ounce water bottles for every 100 miles I travel, rounded to the nearest 100. Assuming I follow I-40 from Los Angeles to Cincinnati, then take I-90 from Cincinnati to Augusta, how many dollars will I get back according to Wikipedia?

‚ö†Ô∏è  REMEMBER: All your work must contribute to answering the ORIGINAL TASK above!

To determine how many dollars you will get back from recycling your water bottles, we need to follow these steps:

1. Calculate the total distance of the trip from Los Angeles to Augusta via I-40 and I-90.
2. Determine the number of water bottles consumed based on the distance.
3. Find out the recycling rate per bottle from Wikipedia.

Let's start by calculating the total distance of the trip. I will use the sandbox_python_execute tool to calculate the distance from Los Angeles to Cincinnati via I-40 and from Cincinnati to Augusta via I-90.

üéØ ORIGINAL TASK REQUIREMENT:
It's May 2023, and I'm about to drive across the U.S. from California to Maine. I always recycle my water bottles at the end of a trip, and I drink 5 12-ounce water bottles for every 100 miles I travel, rounded to the nearest 100. Assuming I follow I-40 from Los Angeles to Cincinnati, then take I-90 from Cincinnati to Augusta, how many dollars will I get back according to Wikipedia?
================================================================================

Tool result: Observed output of cmd `browser_use` executed:
Search Results:
Search results for 'recycling rate per bottle site:wikipedia.org':

1. PET bottle recycling
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PET_bottle_recycling
   Description: recycling. Bottle flake is melted into its new shape directly with basic changes in its physical properties. "Chemical" or "advanced" recycle. Bottle

2. Container deposit legislation in the United States
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Container_deposit_legislation_in_the_United_States
   Description: container deposit laws have a 70% average rate of beverage container recycling. Michigan's recycling rate of 97% from 1990 to 2008 was the highest in

3. Oregon Bottle Bill
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oregon_Bottle_Bill
   Description: Benjamin, et al. found bottle deposit law only had a small impact of about 3% for clear glass and aluminum recycling rate when bottle deposit law coexists

Previous Steps Context:
Step 1 (DistanceCalculator - success): To determine how many dollars you will get back from recycling your water bottles, we need to follow these steps:

1. Calculate the total distance of the trip from Los Angeles to Augusta via I-40 and I-90.
2. Determine the number of water bottles consumed based on the distance.
3. Find out the recycling rate per bottle from Wikipedia.

Let's start by calculating the total distance of the trip. I will use the sandbox_python_execute tool to calculate the distance from Los Angeles to Cincinnati via I-40 and from Cincinnati to Augusta via I-90.
